author: chris2_2_2
content: Chia network has a pi 4 manufacturer that sells them along with a custom client that works well on pi. Would be great if eth had a pi4 that was modded to be optimized for running a validator.

author: 0x2e
content: you don't need any modifications to a pi4 to do that, as a matter of fact people are already staking from pis without any issues.

author: chris2_2_2
content:
Don’t need but a gui os that integrates it and makes it easy like an iPhone would help.

I think most crypto core developers don’t consider the common user in their product.

author: 0x2e
content: there are projects like dappnode and avado that offer this already

author: 0x2e
content: Dont see how this has to be any concern to a core dev, the community should tackle such an issue itself

author: acid0003
content: why not offer a validator as an iphone app?

author: acid0003
content: it has both 4g and wifi :)

author: treyzania
content: not nearly enough storage

author: treyzania
content: I believe the ios apis make it hard to have ongoing long running background tasks, you're limited to things like polling a server for new emails and such

author: treyzania
content: also most users have pretty constrained mobile bandwidth so they'd have to be on wifi most of the time anyways, they might as well get a nuc and not be limited by apple's walled gardens
